thread.title: Osinbajo summons Nigeria police chief over kidnap of German archaeologists
thread.title_full: Osinbajo summons Nigeria police chief over kidnap of German archaeologists

author: Garba Muhammad
title: Osinbajo summons Nigeria police chief over kidnap of German archaeologists
text:
Letter to all honest Nigerians 
My uncle was kidnapped last year nobody summoned anybody to help. I am not a German citizen. I am a full-blown Nigeria. So, what are we saying? 
The other day I saw Sanusi Lamido Sanusi – the Emir of Kwankwanso, oh, sorry, 
Emir of Kano – rushing to the presidential villa two weeks ago, I suspected that 
Muhamadu Buhari is not coming back. Sanusi Lamido could not tell journalists 
what he came to beg Acting Vice President Yemi Osinbajo. The issue now is: Acting president should tell us what was discussed. We can never agree that any Emir should carry go 1.4 trillion Naira. Better to break up Nigeria then. 
A lot of people concluded that Sanusi Lamido must therefore have come to the presidential villa in his own self-interest. Some other people said Sanusi Lamido feared that without Muhamadu Buhari who was helping him in the last 20 months to sweep the case under the carpet, his pending case of 1.4 trillion Naira missing at the Central Bank under his tenure might be brought to court as a criminal case of theft. 
The federal government audit shows that the missing money passed through his hands. If that is the case, Sanusi Lamido is not getting good legal advice. Theft or crime cannot be negotiated. Theft or crime has no time-limit for prosecution. No statute of limitations. It can be brought to court and prosecuted at any time. It is naive to expect that Acting President Yemi Osinbajo will intentionally overlook the case and end up disgracing himself, like Muhamadu Buhari. For what? To achieve what? Is Osinbajo a Hausa man? Vextra

Some other people said Sanusi Lamido feared that without Muhamadu Buhari who was helping him in the last 20 months to sweep the case under the carpet, his pending case of 1.4 trillion Naira missing at the Central Bank under his tenure might be brought to court as a criminal case of theft.

Concerned Nigeriana 
@Vextra: 
Muhamadu Buhari is the worst president Nigeria has ever had; the least educated, the most dishonest, the most crooked, the worst mentally lazy, the most bereft, the most denuded of thought-process, and, the most inarticulate stammering Islamist bigot ever to enter the presidential villa flying Fulani tribe flag. We dey hear 
“Nigeria’s inflation has risen to 18.55 per cent, its highest in more than 11 years, according to the latest data from the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS). all major food sub-indexes increased, with soft drinks recording the slowest pace of increase at 7.66 percent (year on year). Added to this, communication, restaurants and hotels recorded the slowest pace of growth in December, growing at 5.33 per cent and 8.91 per cent (year-on-year) respectively. 
The Nigerian crisis has even long spread to global airlines. In the latest illustration of the economic crisis engulfing Nigeria under Buhari, United Airlines had discontinued daily flights between Lagos, the commercial capital, and Houston in the US whilst Iberia, the Spanish airliner, cancelled all four of its weekly flights to Nigeria last May.” 
……….Newsreports
